question: The Chach Nama, originally an Arabic work, was translated into Persian by which of the following?
option2: Muhammad Ali bin Abu Bakr Kufi
answer: Muhammad Ali bin Abu Bakr Kufi
explanation: The Chach Nama which was originally an Arabic work was translated into Persian by Muhammad Ali bin Abu Bakr Kufi during the time of Nasiruddin Qabacha. It is considered to be the main source of information on the Arab conquest of Sind.
